channel.title: BSOD when starting whonix machine on win
channel.description:
Hi.
Since I had an hard time starting my Whonix machine/s, getting many BSOD, I'll just leave a (sort of) advice:
If you have Docker installed, most probably you have Windows Hyper-v module enabled. That could be the cause for BSOD when turning on a machine from Virtualbox. Try turning Hyper-v off.
http://www.poweronplatforms.com/enable-disable-hyper-v-windows-10-8/
Note I was doing just some tests, as you already know, it's not the best thing running Whonix on windows host as mentioned in the Docs,
regards

item.title: BSOD when starting whonix machine on win
item.dc:creator: realware-it
item.description:
Hi.

Since I had an hard time starting my Whonix machine/s, getting many BSOD, I’ll just leave a (sort of) advice:

If you have Docker installed, most probably you have Windows Hyper-v module enabled. That could be the cause for BSOD when turning on a machine from Virtualbox. Try turning Hyper-v off.

PowerON – 24 Feb 16

How to Enable and Disable Hyper-V in Windows 10 & 8 - PowerON

How to Enable and Disable Hyper-V in Windows 10 & 8 I’m currently spending a lot of time with our customers helping them move towards Windows 10 from their current Windows 7 environment.  Due to there being no inbuilt type two hypervisor…

Note I was doing just some tests, as you already know, it’s not the best thing running Whonix on windows host as mentioned in the Docs,

regards
